full_text:
Good morning Christine,

I apologize, but Warden Petrucci told me he won't be able to make it on Tuesday. As you likely know, we've had quite a few visitors here at MCC recently. The Warden just learned about a meeting on Tuesday morning, and he needs to be in attendance. That said, he would welcome the opportunity to meet Judge Berman another time. Perhaps the Warden and I could go over to the courthouse sometime next week at a time convenient for the Judge? Please let me know if that sounds feasible.

Thank you for your help, and I look forward to seeing you on Monday (redacted) and Tuesday.

Best,
(redacted)
Staff Attorney
CLC New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center
150 Park Row
New York, NY 10007
p: 646-836-(redacted)
f: 646-836-7665

>>> (redacted) 8/21/2019 11:06 AM >>>
Good morning Christine,

Please thank Judge Berman for the invitation! (redacted) is out of the office until next Thursday, but Warden Petrucci and I will attending the hearing in his absence. If there is anything Judge Berman wishes us to address either before or during the hearing, please don't hesitate to let me know.

Thank you,
(redacted)
Staff Attorney
CLC New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center
150 Park Row
New York, NY 10007
p: 646-836-(redacted)
f: 646-836-7665

>>> (redacted)@nysd.uscourts.gov> 8/21/2019 9:06 AM >>>
Please see attached Order.

Judge Berman asked me to invite you and the new warden to the hearing.
(See attached file: epstein aug 21 Order.pdf)

Page 4209
DOJ-OGR-00024221

additional_notes: The document is an email chain with redactions. The redactions are likely due to privacy or security concerns.
